critique: This document pertains to the temporary withdrawal of public lands in Oklahoma for flood-control purposes by the War Department. It does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, executive power, or social inclusion. It has a slight impact on federalism and economic regulation. The order centralizes control over these lands at the federal level and withdraws them from settlement, location, sale, or entry, which could be seen as a form of economic intervention. There is no mention of national security or civil liberties.
